name: zero_add
statement: theorem zero_add (n : MyNat) : add zero n = n := by
proof:
theorem zero_add (n : MyNat) : add zero n = n := by
  induction n with
  | zero =>
    rw [add_zero]
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [add_succ]
    rw [ih]

name: succ_add
statement: theorem succ_add (a b : MyNat) : add (succ a) b = succ (add a b)  := by
proof:
theorem succ_add (a b : MyNat) : add (succ a) b = succ (add a b) := by
  induction b with
  | zero =>
    rw [add_zero, add_zero]
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [add_succ, ih, add_succ]
known_theorems: theorem zero_add (n : MyNat) : add zero n = n := by

name: add_comm
statement: theorem add_comm (a b : MyNat) : add a b = add b a := by
proof:
theorem add_comm (a b : MyNat) : add a b = add b a := by
  induction a with
  | zero =>
    rw [zero_add]
    rw [add_zero]
  | succ k ih =>
    rw [succ_add]
    rw [add_succ]
    rw [ih]

proof:
theorem add_assoc (a b c : MyNat) : add (add a b) c = add a (add b c) := by
  induction c with
  | zero =>
    rw [add_zero, add_zero]
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [add_succ, add_succ, ih, add_succ]

name: two_plus_two_ne_five
statement: theorem two_plus_two_ne_five : add (succ (succ zero)) (succ (succ zero)) ≠ succ (succ (succ (succ (succ zero)))) := by
proof:
theorem two_plus_two_ne_five : add (succ (succ zero)) (succ (succ zero)) ≠ succ (succ (succ (succ (succ zero)))) := by
  -- Simplify add two two to four
  rw [add_succ, add_succ, add_zero]
  -- Now we need to show succ (succ (succ (succ zero))) ≠ succ (succ (succ (succ (succ zero))))
  -- Apply succ_inj four times to reduce to zero ≠ succ zero
  apply succ_inj
  apply succ_inj
  apply succ_inj
  apply succ_inj
  -- Now we have zero ≠ succ zero, which is zero_ne_succ zero
  exact zero_ne_succ zero

name: add_algo_1
statement: theorem add_algo_1 (a b c d : MyNat) : add (add a b) (add c d) = add (add (add a c) d) b := by
proof:
theorem add_algo_1 (a b c d : MyNat) : add (add a b) (add c d) = add (add (add a c) d) b := by
  rw [add_assoc]                    -- LHS: add a (add b (add c d))
  rw [add_assoc, add_assoc]         -- RHS: add a (add c (add d b))
  rw [← add_assoc b c d]            -- LHS: add a (add (add b c) d)
  rw [add_comm b (add c d)]         -- LHS: add a (add (add c d) b)
  rw [add_assoc]                    -- LHS: add a (add c (add d b))
  -- Now both sides are identical: add a (add c (add d b))
  rfl

name: add_mul
statement: theorem add_mul (a b c : MyNat) : mul (add a b) c = add (mul a c) (mul b c) := by
proof:
theorem add_mul (a b c : MyNat) : mul (add a b) c = add (mul a c) (mul b c) := by
  induction c with
  | zero =>
    -- Base case
    rw [mul_zero, mul_zero, mul_zero, add_zero]
  | succ d ih =>
    -- Inductive step
    rw [mul_succ, mul_succ, mul_succ]
    rw [ih]
    -- Now we need to rearrange terms using add_assoc and add_comm
    rw [add_assoc, add_assoc]
    nth_rewrite 2 [add_comm b]
    rw [← add_assoc, add_comm (mul b d), add_assoc]
    rw [add_assoc (mul a d)]
    nth_rewrite 3 [add_comm a]
    rw [add_assoc]

name: mul_pow
statement: theorem mul_pow (a b n : MyNat) : pow (mul a b) n = mul (pow a n) (pow b n) := by
proof:
theorem mul_pow (a b n : MyNat) : pow (mul a b) n = mul (pow a n) (pow b n) := by
  induction n with
  | zero =>
    -- Base case
    rw [pow_zero, pow_zero, pow_zero]
    rw [mul_one]
  | succ k ih =>
    -- Inductive step
    rw [pow_succ, pow_succ, pow_succ]
    rw [ih]
    rw [mul_assoc (pow a k) (pow b k) (mul a b)]
    rw [mul_comm (pow b k) (mul a b)]
    rw [← mul_assoc (pow a k) (mul a b) (pow b k)]
    rw [mul_assoc (pow a k) a b]
    rw [mul_comm b (pow b k)]
    rw [← mul_assoc (mul (pow a k) a) b (pow b k)]
    rw [mul_assoc b (pow b k) k]
    rw [mul_comm b (pow b k)]
    rw [mul_assoc (mul (pow a k) a) (mul (pow b k) b) k]
    done

name: le_antisymm
statement: theorem le_antisymm (x y : MyNat) (hxy : le x y) (hyx : le y x) : x = y := by
proof:
theorem le_antisymm (x y : MyNat) (hxy : le x y) (hyx : le y x) : x = y := by
  cases hxy with | intro c hc =>
  cases hyx with | intro d hd =>
  rw [hd] at hc
  rw [add_assoc] at hc
  have h := add_right_eq_self (add d c) y hc.symm
  have hdc_zero : add d c = zero := h
  have hd_zero := add_right_eq_zero d c hdc_zero
  have hc_zero := add_left_eq_zero d c hdc_zero
  rw [hd_zero] at hd
  rw [add_zero] at hd
  exact hd.symm

name: le_total
statement: theorem le_total (x y : MyNat) : (le x y) ∨ (le y x) := by
proof:
theorem le_total (x y : MyNat) : (le x y) ∨ (le y x) := by
  induction x with
  | zero =>
    left
    apply zero_le
  | succ x ih =>
    induction y with
    | zero =>
      right
      apply zero_le
    | succ y ih_y =>
      cases ih y with
      | inl h =>
        left
        cases h with
        | intro c hc =>
          use c
          rw [hc, succ_add]
      | inr h =>
        right
        cases h with
        | intro c hc =>
          use c
          rw [hc, succ_add]

name: succ_le_succ
statement: theorem succ_le_succ (x y : MyNat) (hx : le (succ x) (succ y)) : le x y := by
proof:
theorem succ_le_succ (x y : MyNat) (hx : le (succ x) (succ y)) : le x y := by
  -- Unpack the definition of le in hx to get ∃ c, succ y = add (succ x) c
  rw [le_iff_exists_add] at hx
  cases hx with | intro c hc => 
  -- Now hc: succ y = add (succ x) c
  -- Rewrite add (succ x) c using add_succ
  rw [add_succ] at hc
  -- Now hc: succ y = succ (add x c)
  -- Apply injectivity of succ
  apply succ_inj at hc
  -- Now hc: y = add x c
  -- Show x ≤ y by using c as witness
  rw [le_iff_exists_add]
  use c
  exact hc

name: le_one
statement: theorem le_one (x : MyNat) (hx : le x one) : x = zero ∨ x = one := by
proof:
theorem le_one (x : MyNat) (hx : le x one) : x = zero ∨ x = one := by
  rw [le_iff_exists_add] at hx
  cases hx with
  | intro c hc =>
    cases x with
    | zero =>
      left
      rfl
    | succ n =>
      right
      rw [add_succ] at hc
      apply succ_inj at hc
      have h := add_right_eq_zero n c hc
      cases h with
      | intro hn hc =>
        rw [hn]
        rfl

name: le_two
statement: theorem le_two (x : MyNat) (hx : le x two) : x = zero ∨ x = one ∨ x = two := by
proof:
theorem le_two (x : MyNat) (hx : le x two) : x = zero ∨ x = one ∨ x = two := by
  cases x with
  | zero =>
    left
    rfl
  | succ d =>
    cases d with
    | zero =>
      right
      left
      rfl
    | succ e =>
      right
      right
      cases e with
      | zero =>
        rfl
      | succ f =>
        have h : le (succ (succ (succ f))) two := hx
        rw [le_iff_exists_add] at h
        cases h with | intro c hc =>
        rw [two_eq_succ_one, add_succ] at hc
        have hc' : succ (add (succ (succ f)) c) = succ one := hc
        have hc'' : add (succ (succ f)) c = one := succ_inj _ _ hc'
        rw [add_succ] at hc''
        have hc''' : succ (add (succ f) c) = one := hc''
        rw [one_eq_succ_zero] at hc'''
        have hc'''' : add (succ f) c = zero := succ_inj _ _ hc'''
        have hcz : c = zero := add_right_eq_zero _ _ hc''''
        rw [hcz, add_zero] at hc''''
        contradiction

  | succ d ih =>
    rw [mul_succ]
    rw [add_comm]
    use (mul a d)
    rfl

name: mul_right_eq_one
statement: theorem mul_right_eq_one (x y : MyNat) (h : mul x y = one) : x = one := by
proof:
theorem mul_right_eq_one (x y : MyNat) (h : mul x y = one) : x = one := by
  cases x with
  | zero =>
    rw [mul_zero] at h
    contradiction
  | succ n =>
    cases n with
    | zero =>
      rfl
    | succ k =>
      rw [mul_succ] at h
      have h_add : add (mul (succ k) y) y = one := h
      cases y with
      | zero =>
        rw [mul_zero, add_zero] at h_add
        have h_mul : mul (succ k) zero = one := h_add
        rw [mul_zero] at h_mul
        contradiction
      | succ m =>
        rw [← succ_eq_add_one, add_succ] at h_add
        have h_succ : succ (add (mul (succ k) (succ m)) (succ m)) = one := h_add
        contradiction

name: mul_ne_zero
statement: theorem mul_ne_zero (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (hb : b ≠ zero) : mul a b ≠ zero := by
proof:
theorem mul_ne_zero (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (hb : b ≠ zero) : mul a b ≠ zero := by
  -- Express b as succ n since b ≠ zero
  cases (eq_succ_of_ne_zero b hb) with
  | intro n hn =>
    rw [hn]
    -- Now prove mul a (succ n) ≠ zero by induction on n
    induction n with
    | zero =>
      -- Base case: b = one
      rw [one_eq_succ_zero, mul_succ, mul_zero, add_zero]
      exact ha
    | succ d ih =>
      -- Inductive step
      rw [mul_succ]
      intro h
      have h1 := add_right_eq_zero (mul a (succ d)) a h
      cases h1 with
      | intro h2 h3 =>
        apply ha h3

name: mul_left_cancel
statement: theorem mul_left_cancel (a b c : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = mul a c) : b = c := by
proof:
theorem mul_left_cancel (a b c : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = mul a c) : b = c := by
  induction b with
  | zero =>
    rw [mul_zero] at h
    cases (mul_eq_zero a c) with
    | inl h1 => contradiction
    | inr h2 => exact h2
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [mul_succ] at h
    cases c with
    | zero =>
      rw [mul_zero] at h
      apply add_right_eq_zero at h
      contradiction
    | succ e =>
      rw [mul_succ] at h
      apply add_right_cancel at h
      rw [ih h]

name: mul_right_eq_self
statement: theorem mul_right_eq_self (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = a) : b = one := by
proof:
theorem mul_right_eq_self (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = a) : b = one := by
  induction b with
  | zero =>
    rw [mul_zero] at h
    contradiction
  | succ d ih =>
    rw [mul_succ] at h
    rw [add_left_eq_self] at h
    cases mul_eq_zero a d h with
    | inl h1 => contradiction
    | inr h2 => rw [h2, one_eq_succ_zero]
